title:
A hidden symmetry of complex spacetime and the emergence of the standard
  model algebraic structure
abstract:
When spacetime is considered as a subspace of a wider complex spacetime
manifold, there is a mismatch of the elementary linear representations of their
symmetry groups, the real and complex Poincar\'{e} groups. In particular, no
spinors are allowed for the complex case. When a spin$^{h}$ structure is
implemented on principal bundles in complex spacetime, one is naturally led to
an algebraic structure analogous to the one of the standard model.
